posts.name: alperenyurt
posts.cooked:
Hi!

As you know, last two years nearly all teams bought swerve modules. We also tried, too. Last year we had big problems with delivery and we gave up buying swerve.

After our last regional event, we made r&d and started to build our swerve modules in our workshop with our possibilities.

Firstly we made aluminium parts.(you can find the production videos in our instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/p/CeEtqDMoCYr/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link https://www.instagram.com/p/CezEYJ2opmO/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link https://www.instagram.com/p/ChH0InjIyrH/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link

Finally, we mounted all the components and created the module.

Our drivetrain is 13,3Kg (29,32lbs) without electroniccomponents / 17,7kg(39,02lbs) with electronic components.

And this is our showcase video:

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked:
Very nice!

With spiral bevel gears, is there a difference in rotating the wheels forwards vs backwards?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: alperenyurt
posts.cooked: @AriMB Our tires turning only one direction.When we want to go opposite way the tires are turning 180 degrees and start spinning same direction. You can see it our showcase video. (second 0.48*)

posts.name: Andrew Schreiber
posts.cooked:
You might want to change this to improve responsiveness. Reversing the drive is faster than spinning the whole module (usually)

But otherwise, looks good.

posts.name: Drakxii
posts.cooked: Just wondering, what advantages were realized with this choice?

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: The problem is spiral bevel gears usually work much better in one direction than the other. To a point where some may not even be able to spin the other direction. That‚Äôs why most COTS swerves use straight bevel gears.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: alperenyurt
posts.cooked:
@Andrew_Schreiber @AriMB @Drakxii

Spiral bevel gears give us a better grip.

And we haven‚Äôt got a problem with this gears.They are working very well.

We love customizations. Example we made our tires. WhatsApp G√∂rsel 2023-03-10 saat 20.29.27 737√ó1600 109 KB

WhatsApp G√∂rsel 2023-03-10 saat 20.29.27 737√ó1600 109 KB

WhatsApp G√∂rsel 2023-03-10 saat 20.29.27 737√ó1600 109 KB

We are using these tires for three months now and we still don‚Äôt need to replace them because they still look good. These tires have 2 nice advantages:

excellent grip (especially on the ramp)

excellent grip (especially on the ramp)

we don‚Äôt need to replace for very long time

we don‚Äôt need to replace for very long time

posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

suggested_topics.title: Acrylic on robots
suggested_topics.excerpt: Purely aesthetics, you could probably get away with it for a bit, if you get it thick enough. Especially if your aesthetic includes cracks through the acrylic. Polycarb seems like it‚Äôs a bit cheaper‚Ä¶

suggested_topics.title: CTRE swerve lags
suggested_topics.excerpt: Another data point that I saw as a CSA at an off-season event, double check that there are no extra motor controllers in your code that you aren‚Äôt using on the robot. There was a team that had problem‚Ä¶
